snippet: The two-day offensive, which involved 8,000 Kurdish fighters, was the largest one to date in the war against the Islamic State.
abstract: Surge of American airstrikes helps Kurdish forces recapture territory in Iraq from Islamic State militants and opens path for autonomous Kurdish region to Mount Sinjar in west, near Syrian border.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The two-day offensive, which involved 8,000 Kurdish fighters, was the largest one to date in the war against the Islamic State.

headline.main: Backed by U.S. Airstrikes, Kurds Reverse an ISIS Gain
headline.print_headline: Backed by U.S. Airstrikes, Kurds Reverse an ISIS Gain

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
